pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we ported a part of Andrew Yang's lean3 repository at [this repository](https://github.com/erdOne/lean-AG-morphisms), which is appoved by @erdOne after his discussion with @chrisflav.

Andrew defined `min_generator_card` and `spanrank` in this repository (it's at /dimension_theory/min_generator_card), we ported this, and ported some basic lemmas about it.

Co-authored-by:
@erdOne
@xyzw12345 [wangjt2020@163.com](mailto:wangjt2020@163.com)
@jjdishere [emailboxofjjd@163.com](mailto:emailboxofjjd@163.com)
@Blackfeather007 [2100017455@stu.pku.edu.cn](mailto:2100017455@stu.pku.edu.cn)

--- 
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thank you very much for your review comments! I have modified it according to your suggestion. In particular, `minGeneratorCard` has been renamed by `spanRankNat`. Please let me know if there's anything else that needs to be changed!

### PR summary [8875810f01](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20744/commits/8875810f019cbd705125a14cb7ca745a986deb0e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.SpanRank` (new file)|921|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FG.exists_fun_spanFinrank_span_range_eq`
`+ FG.generators`
`+ FG.generators_mem`
`+ FG.spanRank_le_iff_exists_span_range_eq`
`+ FG.span_range_generators`
`+ fg_iff_spanRank_eq_spanFinrank`
`+ spanFinrank`
`+ spanFinrank_eq_iInf`
`+ spanRank`
`+ spanRank_bot`
`+ spanRank_eq_iInf`
`+ spanRank_eq_zero_iff_eq_bot`
`+ spanRank_ne_top_iff_fg`
`+ spanRank_span_set_finite`
`+ spanRank_sup_le_sum_spanRank`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks for the comments! We've made some changes accordingly, added several lemmas, and also renamed `minGenerator` as `spanBasis`.
If you merge `master` into this branch then you'll stop all those stupid `messageFile.md` messages, by the way.
Thanks, last comments.
Thanks a lot for all the porting work! I left some comments.
Sorry for suggesting changes to the basic defs so late but after thinking about this some more I feel like these might be more natural.

LGTM. Thanks a lot for doing this!
I shouldn't be the one maintainer-merging this though.
Thanks, last comments.

```suggestion
* `minGeneratorCard`: The minimum cardinality of a generating set of a submodule as a natural number.
  If no finite generating set exists, the minimum cardinality is defined to be `0`.
```

Could you please use the nice `ENat` notation here? And explain the difference between `spanRank` and `minGeneratorCard`.

Also I am not sure about the naming. I think the two should be named similarly, maybe `Submodule.spanRank` and `Submodule.spanRankNat`?
Could you please also implement the `ℕ∞` part of my comment?

```suggestion
* `FG.exists_fun_minGeneratorCard_span_range_eq` : Any finitely generated submodule has a generating
  family of cardinality equal to `minGeneratorCard`.
```
And please also adapt the wording here.
Maybe `@[simp]`?
I don't think this lemma is needed.

```suggestion
/-- An arbitrarily chosen generating family of minimal cardinality. -/
noncomputable def FG.minGenerator {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) : Fin p.minGeneratorCard → M :=
  Classical.choose (exists_fun_minGeneratorCard_span_range_eq h)
```

```suggestion
lemma FG.span_range_minGenerator {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) :
```

```suggestion
lemma FG.minGenerator_mem {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) (i) :
```

```suggestion
lemma fg_iff_spanrank_eq_minGeneratorCard {p : Submodule R M} :
```
Does the `simp` have to be squeezed here? In general, if it is a terminal `simp`, please avoid `simp only` if possible.
Do you need the `f'`? It seems, it is only used once and then unfolded immediatly in multiple places.

```suggestion
lemma fg_iff_spanRank_eq_spanRankNat {p : Submodule R M} :
```

Sorry, maybe my comments were not very clear. I don't think "span rank of a submodule" is a common term. I am fine with keeping it as the name of the `def`, because it is nice and short. But I think you should explain the term in the docstring and don't use it in the title. "Cardinality of minimal generating set of a submodule" for example.

```suggestion
  · intro e
    rw [← spanRank_ne_top_iff_fg, e]
    exact WithTop.coe_ne_top
```

```suggestion
    span R (Set.range (minGenerator h)) = p :=
```

```suggestion
lemma FG.minGenerator_mem {p : Submodule R M} (h : p.FG) (i : Fin p.spanRankNat) :
```

Sorry if my previous comment was unclear: The "don't squeeze `simp`" policy only refers to *terminal* `simp`s, i.e. that appear at the end of proofs. If it is in the middle of the proof, you should still use `simp only`. See https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html#squeezing-simp-calls for more details.

```suggestion
    p.spanRank ≤ n ↔ ∃ f : Fin n → M, span R (Set.range f) = p := by
```

```suggestion
    ∃ f : Fin p.spanRankNat → M, span R (Set.range f) = p := by
```

Maybe it is helpful to read https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html#structuring-definitions-and-theorems, in particular the paragraph:

> If the theorem statement requires multiple lines, indent the subsequent lines by 4 spaces. The proof is still indented only 2 spaces (not 6 = 4 + 2). When providing a proof in tactic mode, the by is placed on the line prior to the first tactic; however, by should not be placed on a line by itself. In practice this means you will often see := by at the end of a theorem statement.
`spanRankNat.proof_1` is a code smell. Does this indicate that you are missing some API?
I guess not really. It's simply the s.Finite part in {s // s.Finite ∧ span R s = p} stated in a pretty weird way (which we have already corrected it now).

```suggestion
  haveI t1 : Finite (@Set.Elem M s) := h₁
```
This is a proof, not data.
Thanks! We've fixed that one now

```suggestion
    exact ⟨fun _ ↦ 0, by simp⟩
```

```suggestion
    (Submodule.span R s).spanRank ≤ hs.toFinset.card := by
```
Can you define this as `(spanRank p).toNat` and show that it is equal to this?
And I think this should be called `spanFinrank` following `rank` and `finrank`.
Good name! Thanks for the suggestion! The lemmas have been updated now.

```suggestion
  ⨅ (s : Set M) (hs : span R s = p), s.encard
```
I think this might be a better definition?
Yeah, you're right! The definition has now been modified according to your suggestion.

```suggestion
```
I don't think this is a basis. perhaps just `FG.generators`?
This looks strange.
It's fixed now. That's probably something useless generated by automatic translation.
Try `Nat.cast_add`? Or perhaps `ENat.coe_add`.
Both actually worked! Thanks for the suggestion.

```suggestion
  simp_rw [← span_range_generators h]
```

```suggestion
In this file, we define the minimum cardinality of a generating set for a submodule, which is
```

```suggestion
/-- A submodule's `spanRank` is not top if and only if it is finitely generated. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A submodule is finitely generated if and only if its `spanRank` is equal to its `spanFinrank`. -/
```
Also, maybe switch LHS and RHS? The RHS seems more complicated.

```suggestion
/-- The span of the generators equals the submodule. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The elements of the generators are in the submodule. -/
```

I don' think the proof should use `Submodule.FG.spanRank_le_iff_exists_span_range_eq` as this is a direct consequence of the definition:
```suggestion
lemma spanRank_span_le_encard (s : Set M) :
    (Submodule.span R s).spanRank ≤ s.encard :=
  biInf_le _ (by constructor)
```
Note also I replaced `(s : Set R)` by `(s : Set M)` and `hs.toFinset.card` by `s.encard` dropping the
`Set.Finite` assumption. Then you can have this as a finite version:
```
lemma spanFinrank_span_le_ncard_of_finite {s : Set M} (hs : s.Finite) :
    (span R s).spanFinrank ≤ s.ncard := by
  rw [← ENat.coe_le_coe]
  convert spanRank_span_set_finite (R := R) s
  · simpa [spanFinrank] using (⟨hs.toFinset, by simp⟩ : (span R s).FG)
  · exact hs.cast_ncard_eq
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Module): the minimum cardinality of generating set
